column1: Lehigh Acres was developed in the mid-1950s by Chicago businessman Lee Ratner. Seeking a tax shelter
column2: Ratner had sold his pest control business and faced the possibility of losing most of his earnings to the high capital gains tax of that era. Ratner heard that cattle was a good investment for people in his predicament
column4: 000 acres (73 km2) of land in eastern Lee County and named it the Lucky Lee Ranch. After ranching for a while
column5: and despite having no prior development experience
column6: Ratner joined with Gerald H. Gould
column11: a former Chicagoan who was in the real estate business in California
column12: and began land sales at Lehigh Acres.Gerald Gould was the president of the corporation that developed Lehigh Acres
column13: which began in 1954. He remained as president until the company was sold in 1972.

column1: A surge in housing prices led to a boom in Lehigh Acres new-housing construction from 2003 to 2007
column3: 500 new homes constructed in 2006. The number of homes built during this period exceeded the total number of homes constructed during the preceding 50 years.But as in much of the United States
